lib
Interface RootAppletProtocol

All Known Implementing Classes:
commonRootApplet, RootApplet
public interface RootAppletProtocol

this class defines the behavior we expect from the root applet.

the many constant keywords are the names expected as applet parameters. Using these names instead of random strings is recommended because it makes the users easy to locate, and it helps avoid bug-by-typo.

In most cases, all the relevant information from the applet parameters will have been transferred into the common sharedInfo object, so you shouldn't routinely use the methods to get applet parameters except in a debugging or development context.

Author:
ddyer
